author: Staff Reporter
text:
Additional District and Session Judge A. Mohammed Jeyabudeen sentenced six persons to double life imprisonment in a murder for gain case.

They were P. Yesudas (27), S. Mayandi (23), S. Subburaj (28), B. Thangaraj (24), B. Prabhakaren (25) and S. Thangaraj (26), all native of Tirunelveli district.

P. Venkatachalapathy, the Additional Public Prosecutor, said that the six persons sentenced for life imprisonment for cases registered under Sections 302 (murder) and 396 (dacoity with murder) were listed as accused no: 2 to accused no: 7 in the case.

Juvenile

The main person who was found in ‘conflict with law’ would be put on trial in a court dealing with juvenile cases as he was only 16 years of age when he committed the crime, he said.

These seven persons murdered P. Thangam (57), wife of a retired police Inspector, in Vijayapuram in 2012 and took away 18 sovereigns of jewellery and Rs. 15,000 from the house.

They attacked her with deadly weapons while she was alone.
title: Six sentenced to double life imprisonment for murder
